result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Barajas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Barajas

records.addlTxt: Restitution Notice mailed to victim on 06/15/17. vp

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Luis Barajas in court PRO SE.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Luis Barajas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State complied with victim notification. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-No contact with victim Anayeli C-C. unless approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment upon being physically cleared.
-No contact with firearms.
-Restitution in the amount of $519.99 to Anayeli C-C.
-Pay Restitution, DNA, and DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Bail on deposit to apply to restitution. 
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

Filed: 
-Crime Victim Impact Statement/Restitution Worksheet
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Probation Review Hearing in branch 24.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luis Barajas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

Filed, Crime Victim Impact Statement.

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luis Barajas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. NO FILE IN COURT. Defense requests an adjourned Pretrial Conference due to new discovery. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luis Barajas in court with attorney Michael Reyes. Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests an adjourned Pretrial Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.

Defendant Luis Barajas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Received and filed:
Notice of Retainer. 
 Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Judge Kremers.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24 FORTHWITH.
File forwarded to Branch 24.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

16RM001746  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01/09/2016
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order. Court denied the state's motion for a no firearms order. Defendant to have no contact with A.C-C. (DOB 1/25/91).  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Luis Barajas in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#16-007
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 36.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1-12-16 @ 1:30pm
